instructions:
In a 4 quart pot, melt butter over medium heat. Sauté leek, onion and celery 5 minutes or until vegetables
are tender-crisp. Add broccoli, reduce heat to low, cover and continue to cook for 10 minutes or until
broccoli is almost tender. Blend in flour until evenly distributed, and cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in
broth and water. Add thyme, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and simmer for 3 minutes, stirring constantly,
until slightly thickened. Continue to cook until broccoli is tender. Slowly stir in half-and-half and heat until
soup is hot. Do not boil. Makes 1 1/2 quarts. May be frozen.
ingredients: 2/3 cup diced leek, white and some green tops
name: Cream Of Broccoli Soup
creator: Mary Decker
